description: From Middle English forkerven, from Old English forceorfan (“to cut through, cut off, cut away, cut down”), equivalent to for- +‎ carve.

verbs.description: forcarve (third-person singular simple present forcarves, present participle forcarving, simple past forcorve or forcarved, past participle forcorven or forcarved)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To cut through, cut completely; to carve up; to cut off.
